metadata.feature_description: Configures multi-threaded crawling for improved performance.

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Scheduler from Persona Bar
steps.expected: Scheduler page loads showing all scheduled tasks
steps.actual: Scheduler page loaded successfully showing Task Queue, Scheduler tab, and History tab with all scheduled tasks visible

steps.action: Viewed SCHEDULER tab to see Search: Url Crawler task
steps.expected: Search: Url Crawler task is visible and accessible
steps.actual: Search: Url Crawler task found at ID 19 with Frequency 'Every 1 Day', enabled, next start scheduled. Global Max Threads shows '1' in scheduler header.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Search Crawling settings page loads

steps.action: Navigated to Site Settings > Search > Crawling tab
steps.expected: Crawling settings page loads with configuration options
steps.actual: Crawling settings page loaded successfully showing URL Paths, Duplicates patterns, Included Directories, and Excluded Directories sections

steps.action: Searched for thread count configuration field in Scheduler task edit panel
steps.expected: A field to configure IndexThreads or thread count should be available
steps.actual: No thread count configuration field found in the task edit panel. Only standard scheduler fields visible: Friendly Name, Class Name, Retain History, Servers, Dependencies, Schedule timing, Frequency, Retry settings.

steps.action: Searched for thread count configuration in Search > Crawling settings
steps.expected: A field to configure thread count for multi-threaded crawling should be available
steps.actual: No thread count configuration field found. Crawling tab only shows URL Paths, Duplicates patterns, and Directory inclusion/exclusion settings.

issues: No UI element found in Persona Bar to configure thread count (IndexThreads) for the SearchCrawler
Code analysis confirms IndexThreads setting exists in Spider.cs (line 342-361) and is read from ScheduleHistoryItem.Settings with default value of 1, but no UI field exposes this setting

observations: Code analysis (Spider.cs:342-369) confirms multi-threading capability exists - Start() method accepts 'threads' parameter and creates N DocumentWorker instances for parallel URL processing
IndexThreads setting is stored in ScheduleHistoryItem.Settings and defaults to 1 (SearchSpiderHelper.cs:588)
Thread safety is implemented using lock(this) and Monitor.Wait/Pulse patterns in Spider.cs
The global Scheduler 'Max Threads' setting (shown as '1' in scheduler header) controls overall scheduler thread pool, not per-task threading
The IndexThreads setting may need to be configured via database (ScheduleItemSetting table) or legacy DNN admin interface, as no Persona Bar UI element exposes it
Related UI pages (Scheduler, Search > Crawling) load and function correctly - only the specific thread count configuration UI is missing
